DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate whether novel soft contact lens optical design slow myopia progression
DOC.brief_title: Controlling Myopia Progression With Soft Contact Lenses ( Contact Lens Control )
DOC.criteria: 1 . The subject must 8 12 year age . 2 . At least one subject 's parent legal guardian must read understand English Chinese . 3 . The subject 's manifest objective refraction ( measured auto refractor ) must sphere : 0.25D 4.50D , cylinder : < 1.50D eye . 4 . The subject 's best sphere contact lens correction must lie 0.75D ( good two eye ) 4.25D ( poor two eye ) . 5 . The subject 's cycloplegic objective refraction must : 0.75D 4.00D cylinder : < equal 1.00D eye . 6 . The subject must 1.00D less difference spherical equivalent two eye cycloplegic refraction . 7 . The subject must spectacle lens bestcorrected visual acuity 0.8 ( 20/25 ) good eye . 8 . The subject 's parent legal guardian must read sign STAEMENT OF INFORMED CONSENT subject must read sign Child 's Assent Form provide copy form . 9 . The subject must appear able willing adhere instruction set forth clinical protocol . 1 . Ocular systemic allergy disease may interfere contact lens wear . 2 . Systemic disease autoimmune disease use medication ( e.g . antihistamine ) , may interfere contact lens wear . 3 . Clinically significant ( grade 3 4 ) corneal edema , corneal vascularization , corneal staining , abnormality cornea , may contraindicate contact lens wear . 4 . Clinically significant ( grade 3 4 ) tarsal abnormality bulbar injection might interfere contact lens wear . 5 . Any ocular infection . 6 . Any corneal distortion result previous hard rigid gas permeable contact lens wear . 7 . Any infectious disease ( e.g . hepatitis , tuberculosis ) immunosuppressive disease ( e.g . HIV ) 8 . Diabetes 9 . Anisometropia great 1.00D cycloplegic refraction . 10 . Astigmatism great 1.00D either eye cycloplegic refraction . 11 . Eye injury surgery within eight week immediately prior enrollment study . 12 . Previous refractive surgery , orthokeratology , keratoconus , corneal irregularity either eye . Rigid contact lens wearer enrol study unless rigid contact lenses least 4 week . 13 . Strabismus either eye . 14 . Pupil lid abnormality infection either eye 15 . Central corneal scar either eye 16 . Aphakia either eye 17 . Contraindications contact lens wear dry eye history prior unsuccessful contact lens wear . 18 . History participation prior clinical trial aim control myopia progression . 19 . Surgically altered eye , ocular infection type , ocular inflammation . 20 . An anterior chamber angle grade 2 narrow Van Herrick method
